intro: Parasarcochilus hirticalcar, commonly known as the hairy-stemmed clubmoss, is a member of the family Lycopodiaceae. It is a small, evergreen plant with a creeping, rhizomatous growth habit. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, arranged spirally around the stem. The plant produces spore-bearing cones called strobili, which are clustered at the tips of the stems. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in temperate forests.
